RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $3,850 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 14 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 14 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: I'M A CHI TOO away alertly and pressed the pace three wide entering the first turn, continued to force the issue from the outside of two rivals in the run to the final turn, assumed command entering the final turn and quickly opened a clear advantage, drifted four wide leaving the turn, and held a closing EYE BE SEEING YOU safely at bay late to prove best. EYE BE SEEING YOU settled at the back of the pack while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, launched his bid three wide entering the final turn, swung seven wide entering the lane, and closed willingly through the drive in a solid effort. MAKEITORBREAKIT broke sharply and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from along the rail in the run down the backstretch, was unable to match strides with the winner entering the final turn, and finished two wide in the drive to garner a share. DEBATABLE dueled for the lead from between rivals entering the first turn, continued to battle two wide in the run down the backside, was unable to keep tabs on I'M A CHI TOO entering the final turn while racing one out from the rail, and weakened in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Eye Be Seeing You
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied 3 wide, closed 7 wide, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Makeitorbreakit
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, vied rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Debatable
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, weakened late

ENTRY.NAME: I'm a Chi Too
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, pressed 3w, led 1/4, drifted 1/8, held

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 15000. (PLUS UP TO $5,250 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; , 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 14 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race At A Mile Or Over Since March 14 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, For Each $1,750 To $12,500 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered For Allowances). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WANDALITA broke sharply and tracked the leader into the first turn while racing one out from the rail, forced the issue two wide in the run to the final turn, took the lead from the outside of REA MEA entering the turn, and inched clear in the lane under confident urging. IRISH LUNA tracked the leader into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, and closed willingly from along the rail in the drive to get up for the place. REA MEA away well and raced to the lead from along the rail while tossing her head as the rider tried to slow her down, continued to fight the rider while under snug restrain entering the backstretch, was overtaken entering the final turn, drifted into the two path entering the lane, and was outfinished for the place. ICE BREAKER away alertly and was taken in hand and allowed to settle at the back of a compact field while racing one out from the rail, launched her bid two wide entering the final turn, but was unable to sustain her bid in the stretch drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Rea Mea
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, led rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Wandalita
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2w, rallied 2w, led, inched clear

ENTRY.NAME: Irish Luna
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked rail, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Ice Breaker
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, settled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, needed more

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $3,850 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 14 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since September 1 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TRAPALIS tracked the contested early pace while racing three wide in the run down the backstretch, launched his bid three wide entering the final turn, swept to the lead entering the lane, and quickly drew clear under confident handling. ROLLIE'S SPIRIT broke sharply and dueled for the lead while racing two wide from between rivals entering the first turn, continued to force the issue two wide in the run down the backside and into the final turn, was overtaken entering the lane, but battled gamely from along the inside in the drive to hold the place. BARNEY GOOGLE settled at the back of the pack while racing one out from the rail entering the backstretch, commenced his bid four wide entering the final turn, and found his best stride late while finishing three wide in deep stretch to get up for a share. GROOVY GIRL away well and pressed the pace three wide entering the first turn, rallied two out from the rail entering the final turn, but was outfinished in the late stages. GWEN away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from the inside of two other rivals in the run down the backstretch, struggled to keep up entering the final turn, and faded over the final furlong. ATOMIC HAZE settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, rallied three wide entering the final turn, steadied briefly when losing his path entering the lane, and failed to mount a late bid when called upon.

ENTRY.NAME: Atomic Haze
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied 3 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Barney Google
ENTRY.OWNER: Roberts-Henson Michelle Henson Brad Henson Randy Henson Dan and Irwin Trevor
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 4 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Gwen
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, rallied inside, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Rollie's Spirit
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, dueled 2 wide, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Groovy Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, pressed 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, outfinished late

ENTRY.NAME: Trapalis
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 4 wide, rallied 3 wide, led, drew clear

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $3,850 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 20 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JUVEE TOO unhurried early while dropping back to trail, unleashed his bid from along the rail entering the final turn, and closed determinedly from along the rail in the drive to get up in time. FOOT SOLDIER broke sharply and was allowed to settle off the contested early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, began to advance midway to the final turn, angled three wide to commence his bid entering the final turn, was bumped by KNOPFLER entering the lane, and closed willingly three wide in deep stretch to just miss. KNOPFLER away well and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from along the rail in the run down the backstretch, held a narrow advantage into the final turn, drifted out bumping with FOOT SOLDIER entering the lane, and battled determinedly from between rivals to the wire to just miss. CALAMAZEUS away alertly and dueled for the lead two wide entering the first turn, forced the issue two wide in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, but faded in the late stages. VANCOUVER'S HUNTER chased the leaders into the first turn while racing two wide, before easing off the leaders to gain a tracking trip, held a striking position in the run to the final turn, but had little to offer over the final furlong. CERTIFIABLE stalked the dueling leaders into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, struggled to keep up in the run to the final turn while dropping back to trail, and had nothing to offer over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Knopfler
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, vied rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Vancouver's Hunter
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, lacked response

ENTRY.NAME: Calamazeus
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Certifiable
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, through early

ENTRY.NAME: Juvee Too
ENTRY.OWNER: High Stakes Thoroughbreds and Snow John
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied inside, closed rail, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Foot Soldier
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, settled rail, rallied 3 w, bumped 1/8, closed 3w

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 88. Allowance Purse 25000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 14 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 14 Allowed 4 lbs. (Maiden, Claiming, And Starter Races Not Considered For Allowances) (Preference To Horses T hat Have Not Started For Less Than $25,000).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SOARINGFORTHESUN away alertly and tracked the dueling leaders into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, commenced his bid three wide entering the final turn, collared the leaders entering the lane, and prevailed over CASCADE BILLY following a stretch long battle. CASCADE BILLY pressed the pacesetter two wide entering the backstretch, continued to force the issue from the outside of BOLD ARCH in the run down the backside and through the final turn, was collared by SAILINGFORTHESUN entering the lane, and battled gamely from along the rail in the drive to just miss. BOITANO unhurried early while dropping back to trail entering the backstretch, rallied smartly from just off the rail entering the final turn and closed determinedly three wide in the drive to get up for a share in a game effort. SLEW'S BAK away well and was allowed to settle off the early pace while racing two out from the rail entering the backstretch, rallied three wide through the final turn, but needed more late while finishing three out from the rail in the drive. BOLD ARCH broke sharply and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from along the rail in the run down the backside and into the final turn, but faded in the stretch drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Boitano
ENTRY.OWNER: Snow Roger E Danard Don B and Rozenek Conrad
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Bold Arch
ENTRY.OWNER: Morrison, John and Kim and Sadler, Robin
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, rallied inside, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Cascade Billy
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Snow Mel
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed rail, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: Slew's Bak
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, settled 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Soaringforthesun
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked rail, rallied 3 w, closed 2 w, prevailed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 74. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $3,850 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE FEBRUARY 14 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 14 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 14 A llowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MORETHANSOULTITLE stalked the leaders into the first turn while splitting rivals, chased the leader two out from the rail in the run down the backside, rallied one out from the rail entering the final turn, assumed command in mid stretch and held off a late charge from RING OF KERRY to prevail. RING OF KERRY lagged well back early while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, commenced his bid two wide entering the final turn, and split rivals in deep stretch while finishing with a rush to just miss. AVE'S IN COMMAND broke sharply and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, sprinted to a clear advantage in the run down the backside and into the final turn, was collared in mid stretch and gave way grudgingly in the final strides in a game effort. RACING RIVER stalked the early pace while racing two out from the rail in the run down the backstretch, rallied smartly three wide through the final turn, and finished four wide in the drive. QUAGMIRE away alertly and stalked the early pace while saving ground at the rail, rallied two wide through the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response while finishing three wide in the lane. MCMURPHY settled off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response in an even effort. APPELLANT unhurried early while dropping back to trail entering the backstretch, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but failed to mount a serious late bid. YOU DON'T OWN ME hopped at the start to get away poorly, lagged well off the early pace while racing four wide into the backstretch, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but failed to menace. SIR BARCLAY away well and tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, struggled to maintain his position in the run to the final turn, and weakened over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Ave's in Command
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, clear lead, gave way grudgingly

ENTRY.NAME: You Don't Own Me
ENTRY.COMMENT: hopped start, lagged 4w, rallied 3w, never menaced

ENTRY.NAME: Appellant
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 3 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Sir Barclay
ENTRY.OWNER: Barroby Harold J and Barroby Mrs Harold J
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 2 wide, weakened 1/4

ENTRY.NAME: McMurphy
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied 2 wide, even effort

ENTRY.NAME: Quagmire
ENTRY.OWNER: Henson Lorie Klimes Helen and Pring Sharon
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, stalked rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Morethansoultitle
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3w, rallied 2w, closed 2w, led, held

ENTRY.NAME: Racing River
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Ring of Kerry
ENTRY.COMMENT: lagged rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide, just missed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 75. Claiming Purse 14000. (PLUS UP TO $4,900 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 14 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 14 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $16,000, For Each $1,750 To $12,500 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $20,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KLIMTOGLORY settled off the early pace while racing two out from the rail entering the backstretch, began to advance into a striking position in the run to the final turn, rallied smartly three wide through the final turn, and closed determinedly four wide in the drive to take command in deep stretch and quickly pull clear. RIMFIRE settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail, launched his bid two wide from between rivals entering the final turn, and closed willingly one out from the rail in the drive to prove second best. Y VEE R away well and dueled for the lead from the outside of SLOOP JOHN B entering the backstretch, continued to force the issue from the outside of that rival in the run to the final turn, took control entering the lane, but was outfinished in deep stretch while racing at the rail. COUNTRY COWBOY stalked the leaders into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied three wide entering the final turn, and finished one out from the rail in the drive in an even effort. GREYTOGO broke sharply and stalked the dueling leaders into the backstretch while racing just out from the rail, rallied smartly three wide entering the final turn, but was unable to sustain his bid in the stretch drive. BETTER TONE lagged well back early while racing three wide into the backstretch, rallied four wide entering the final turn, and finished three wide in the drive. WISELY PLAYED lagged well off the early pace while saving ground at the rail, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, but failed to make a serious late impact while finishing one out from the rail in the drive. SLOOP JOHN B away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace from the inside of Y VEE R in the run to the final turn, was quickly overtaken entering the turn, and tired over the final furlong.

ENTRY.NAME: Greytogo
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked inside, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Wisely Played
ENTRY.OWNER: Wilson Warren Sutherland June Stajkowski Neil Hickman Barry and Small Lesley
ENTRY.COMMENT: lagged rail, rallied inside, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Rimfire
ENTRY.OWNER: Anderson, Dr. Bryan C. and Carol
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Sloop John B
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, rallied inside, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Y Vee R
ENTRY.OWNER: Gilker Robert Gilker Victoria and Chu Ernie
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, dueled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, led, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Country Cowboy
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Klimtoglory
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide, best

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Jerry Hollendorfer, George Todaro, JohnStuart & Peter Banc

ENTRY.NAME: Better Tone
ENTRY.COMMENT: lagged 3 wide, rallied 4 wide, closed 3 wide,
